com.android.common

Class Rfc822Validator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.android.common.Rfc822Validator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.AutoCompleteTextView.Validator
    Deprecated. 
    In the future make sure we don't quietly alter the user's text in ways they did not intend. Meanwhile, hide this class from the public API because it does not even have a full understanding of the syntax it claims to correct.

    @Deprecated
public class Rfc822Validator
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.widget.AutoCompleteTextView.Validator
    This class works as a Validator for AutoCompleteTextView for email addresses. If a token does not appear to be a valid address, it is trimmed of characters that cannot legitimately appear in one and has the specified domain name added. It is meant for use with Rfc822Token and Rfc822Tokenizer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rfc822Validator(java.lang.String domain)
      Deprecated. 
      Constructs a new validator that uses the specified domain name as the default when none is specified.

      • setRemoveInvalid

        public void setRemoveInvalid(boolean remove)
        Deprecated. 
        Specify if the validator should remove invalid tokens instead of trying to fix them. This can be used to strip results of incorrectly formatted tokens.
        Parameters:
        remove - true to remove tokens with the wrong format, false to attempt to fix them

      • fixText

        public java.lang.CharSequence fixText(java.lang.CharSequence cs)
        Deprecated. 
        Corrects the specified text to make it valid.
        Specified by:
        fixText in interface android.widget.AutoCompleteTextView.Validator
        Parameters:
        cs - A string that doesn't pass validation: isValid(invalidText) returns false
        Returns:
        A string based on invalidText such as invoking isValid() on it returns true.
        See Also:
        AutoCompleteTextView.Validator.isValid(CharSequence)
